===Etymology===
Originally built during the time of [[w:Emperor Wu of Han|Emperor Wu of Han]], Zhaoyang Hall became the residence of [[w:Empress Zhao Feiyan|Empress Zhao Feiyan]] during the reign of [[w:Emperor Cheng of Han|Emperor Cheng of Han]]. Later poets used Zhaoyang Hall as a general metaphor for the living quarters of imperial consorts.
